patterns: what planets are in solar system
responses: The Solar System - is the gravitationally bound system of the Sun and the objects that orbit it. Our Solar System consist of: Sun Mercury Venus Earth Mars Jupiter Saturn Unanus Neptune and some dwarfs

The Solar System is a collection of celestial bodies that revolve around the Sun. It includes the Sun, eight planets (Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune), dwarf planets (such as Pluto)

patterns: what parts black holes consist of
responses: A black hole is a region of spacetime where gravity is so strong that nothing, including light or other electromagnetic waves, has enough energy to escape its event horizon. The theory of general relativity predicts that a sufficiently compact mass can deform spacetime to form a black hole. The boundary of no escape is called the event horizon.

A black hole is a region in space where the gravitational pull is so strong that not even light can escape it. This results in a dark, invisible region where matter is concentrated, which gives the black hole its name.
Wormhole - is a hypothetical structure connecting disparate points in spacetime, and is based on a special solution of the Einstein field equations.

A wormhole is a hypothetical passage through space-time that would allow matter to travel from one point in the universe to another point in a much shorter distance than it would take through normal space.

patterns: in which galaxy do we live
responses: A galaxy - is a system of stars, stellar remnants, interstellar gas, dust, dark matter, bound together by gravity. The word is derived from the Greek galaxias, literally 'milky', a reference to the Milky Way galaxy, where we live.

A galaxy is a large collection of stars, gas, dust, and dark matter held together by gravitational forces. There are billions of galaxies in the observable universe, each containing anywhere from a few million to several trillion stars. The most well-known galaxy is the Milky Way, which contains our Solar System.
The universe - is all of space and time and their contents, including planets, stars, galaxies, and all other forms of matter and energy.

The universe is everything that exists, including all matter, energy, space, and time. It encompasses all the galaxies, stars, planets, and other objects in space, as well as the laws of physics that govern their behavior.
